Description: Painted pottery shabti with a black curled lappet-wig, a modelled face with the eyes traced in black, a black collar, crossed hands in relief and outlined in black holding two black hoes, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; a fake(?).
Condition: fair - cracked around leg section, paint worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
